New Records: Drew Romo achieved a career-high of 3 RBIs in the game.
Key Match Events: Drew Romo drove in a career-high three runs.
Jordan Beck had a go-ahead RBI single in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Charlie Blackmon added two RBIs with his fourth triple of the season.
Jeff Criswell earned his first career win after pitching a scoreless eighth inning.
Tyler Kinley picked up his eighth save of the season after striking out Adley Rutschman with runners on first and third.
Anthony Santander hit his 39th home run of the season for the Orioles.
Ryan O’Hearn drove in two runs with an RBI single in the fifth inning.
Dean Kremer left the game in the fourth inning after being struck on his right forearm by a line drive.
Ramón Urías left the game early due to a sprained ankle.
Post-Match Reflections: Rockies manager Bud Black emphasized the importance of the game for the integrity of the season.
Drew Romo expressed feeling more comfortable and having better at-bats.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rockies starter Ryan Feltner had a no decision, marking his 22nd consecutive start without a win.
Orioles are 1 1/2 games behind the Yankees in the AL East standings and four games up for the top spot in the AL wild-card race.
